page.title: 02ARABLE FARMING IN MID ESSEX
page.content: Three brothers together own Fithlers, Butt Hatch and Blows Farm and run them as one unit of 500 acres.The large farm house is a fine Victorian build- ing. Although once mixed farms,they are completely arable now,though the old dairy and cow house are still there. Crops give good profits, espe- cially with subsidies. They employ 2 men full-time,one bro- ther can't work any more as he is blind. They usually work an 8 hour day but at busy times much more.A favour- ite job is cutting wheat.Barley"goes down" in stormy weather.They can cut 80-100 tons a day.They depend on the weather being favourable.Fields can't be worked if they are wet.{MACHINERY is expensive,a tractor,giving 10 years service cost Â£14,500 in 1983.It will only be used for deep ploughing for 2-3 years A combine costs Â£45,000.
